title: Afghanistan earthquake: Toll crosses 2200, nearly 4000 injured; rescue under way
description: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has claimed over 2,200 lives and injured nearly 4,000, primarily in Kunar province. Rescue operations are ongoing amidst difficult terrain, complicated by aftershocks, including a 4.8-magnitude tremor. International aid is arriving, with India airlifting 21 tonnes of relief supplies to assist the affected population already struggling with fragile housing and decades of conflict.

title: PM Modi holds bilateral with Singapore PM; discuss Pahalgam attack
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Singaporean Prime Minister Lawrence Wong met in New Delhi, marking a significant step in the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership between India and Singapore. They addressed terrorism concerns, inaugurated the second phase of PSA International’s Mumbai Container Terminal, and announced cooperation in green and digital shipping corridors.

description: India and Singapore strengthen strategic partnership to navigate geopolitical turbulence, focusing on digital technologies and counterterrorism efforts

description: The KNO and UPF have also agreed to relocate seven designated camps away from areas vulnerable to conflict

title: Not for Russia to 'decide' if West can deploy troops to Ukraine: NATO chief
description: Why are we interested in what Russia thinks about troops in Ukraine? It's a sovereign country. It's not for them to decide, says NATO chief Mark Rutte

Shocking claims! 'I was depressed': Amit Mishra on career gap after retirement
description: Amit Mishra, the veteran leg-spinner, has retired from professional cricket after 25 years. He debuted in 2003 but faced a five-year gap due to strong competition. Mishra made a notable Test debut in 2008, claiming five wickets. Despite facing depression, he persevered, focusing on self-improvement. He ended his career with 156 international wickets.

Mumbai records 11,000 property registrations in August, Western and Central suburbs account for 86%
CBSE portal for special needs students: Registration starts Sept 9; apply online
description: Central Board of Secondary Education sets the registration dates for Children With Special Needs. This is for the upcoming Class 10 and 12 board exams in 2026. Schools need to register eligible students on the Pariksha Sangam portal. The registration window is from September 9 to September 22, 2025. Registered students will receive accommodations during exams.

description: ‘Man of Tomorrow’ will come just a year after the release of the ‘Superman’ follow-up, ‘Supergirl,’ and months before Matt Reeves’ ‘The Batman: Part II’

title: What are ‘sin goods’ and why do they now attract the highest GST rate?
description: India’s new GST framework introduces a 40% tax slab on “sin goods” and luxury items, consolidating the earlier 28% rate plus cess into a single levy effective September 22, 2025.

title: CCTV footage exposes brutal police attack on Youth Congress member in Kerala
description: CCTV footage revealed the torture of a Youth Congress worker, V S Sujith, at Kunnamkulam police station, sparking protests and a human rights commission investigation. A magistrate ordered an inquiry against four officers after medical tests disproved police claims of Sujith's intoxication. While departmental action was taken against some officers, further action depends on the court's decision.

title: The K Kavitha case signals deeper problems in India’s regional parties

description: The 61-year-old victim Syed Nisar Ahmed, suffering from paralysis and breathing issues, had come to the hospital in a car with his son and son-in-law for consultation.

GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
description: The Goods and Services Tax Council approved new GST reforms. The council reduced the slabs to 5% and 18%. Nirmala Sitharaman announced the changes. The revised rates take effect from September 22. Consumer electronics like ACs and TVs will see a price cut. Mobile phone and laptop GST rates remain unchanged. Air conditioners and dishwashers will also become cheaper.

title: IIM-Ahmedabad leads, IIT-Delhi in top 10: NIRF 2025 list of best MBA colleges in India
40% tax rate in GST rejig: What are sin goods and why they are in highest slab?
description: The GST Council has approved a significant tax hike on sin and luxury goods, introducing a new 40% slab for items like tobacco, aerated drinks, and premium vehicles. This restructuring aims to simplify the indirect tax system by reducing the number of tax slabs.

title: Dream11 effect: India jerseys being sold at 80% discount; here's how much they cost
description: Indian cricket team's jersey manufacturer Adidas is offering massive discounts, up to 80%, on Indian cricket team jerseys, bringing the price down to as much as Rs 1,199. This follows Dream11's early exit as the team's sponsor due to new online gaming regulations.

title: Being an immigrant in the UK today: Alienated, tired of holding the peace

description: The second phase of the K.C. Valley project would be completed at a cost of ₹446 crore by December 2025

description: The European Commission has argued that the new framework offers significant improvements over the previous mechanisms

title: Renault Kiger Review 2025: Price, features, mileage and performance
description: After getting a bold new design, premium interiors and some new features, Renault the Kiger is a compact SUV that definitely punches above its weight.

title: NIRF 2025 college rankings: Hindu College at No.1; here's the list of top 10
description: The Ministry of Education has released the NIRF Rankings 2025, with Hindu College securing the top spot among India’s best colleges, followed by Miranda House and Hans Raj College. Delhi University continues to dominate, but institutions from West Bengal and Tamil Nadu also feature in the top 10. A new SDG category highlights the rise of sustainable, socially responsible education.

title: Top 10 most populous countries in the world in 2025: Where India stands against China, Pakistan and the US
France hits Google with $381 million fine for consumer protection failures
description: The Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertés (CNIL) also gave Google six months to ensure ads are no longer displayed between emails in Gmail users' inboxes without prior consent

title: Palaniswami welcomes GST Council’s approval of two-rate tax slab
NIRF 2025: IISc B'luru tops; JNU at number 2; see India’s top 10 universities
description: The NIRF 2025 rankings showcase India's leading universities. IISc Bengaluru secures the top spot, followed by JNU New Delhi. MAHE and Jamia Millia Islamia also perform well. These rankings guide students in choosing quality institutions. Private universities are rising, emphasizing research and global collaborations. The rankings consider inclusivity and community engagement. Students can find competitive programs in diverse institutions.

title: Punjab floods: rising Ghaggar waters inundate Patiala villages, fresh alerts issued
GST revamp: Kharge hits out at Centre with ‘one nation, 9 taxes’ jibe
description: Congress has criticized the Centre's GST celebrations, alleging the tax system has become overly complex with multiple slabs, contrary to the original vision. The party highlighted its past advocacy for a simplified GST 2.0, accusing the government of belatedly adopting their suggestions for rate cuts and rationalization. The recent GST Council meeting introduced a two-tier structure, marking a significant revamp.

title: Retired aided college teachers in T.N. hold protest demanding rectification of pay scale anomalies
ED seizes Karnataka Congress MLA K C Veerendra’s 6 luxury cars, freezes Rs 55 crore in betting scam case
GST rate cut on cement, materials: Home prices to dip; move to boost housing demand
description: The GST Council's decision to lower tax rates on cement and granite is being hailed by the real estate sector as a landmark reform. This move is expected to boost housing affordability and demand during the festive season. Developers anticipate reduced construction costs, faster project delivery, and renewed hope for homebuyers seeking affordable prices.

GST rate cuts a booster shot! What do tax changes mean for stock markets? Explained
description: The Modi government's GST rate cuts are injecting vitality into the Indian economy, potentially offsetting US tariffs. Nirmala Sitharaman's reforms, impacting various sectors, sparked a Sensex surge. Analysts predict increased consumption, benefiting auto, FMCG, and cement industries.

Punjab floods: Amid disaster, rail parts maker switches to boats
description: Hanspal Traders, a railway coach component manufacturer in Kapurthala, has shifted its operations to fabricate boats for Punjab flood relief. Prompted by calls from across the state and encouraged by an MLA, the company is also sharing its designs to involve other manufacturers. They aim to produce boats manually, focusing on aiding people and transporting essential supplies.

title: Novak Djokovic dances to KPop Demon Hunters’ ‘Soda Pop’ after US Open quarterfinal win, dedicates it to daughter’s birthday
Building Global Bridges: Nitte University’s Commitment to International Collaboration
Aligarh dowry horror: ‘Jump’, dares hubby, woman leaps off 2nd floor
description: In Aligarh's Daunkoli village, Archana, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly jumped from her roof after enduring years of dowry-related abuse. A video surfaced showing the aftermath, leading to a police case against her husband and in-laws. They are accused of demanding additional dowry of Rs 5 lakh and a motorcycle.

Watch: Pope Leo rides BMW motorcycle in St Peter’s Square
description: Pope Leo XIV received a custom BMW motorcycle from the Christian Jesus Bikers, who rode from Germany to Rome as part of a Jubilee of Hope pilgrimage. The Pope blessed and signed the bike, which will be auctioned in Munich to benefit children working in mica mines in Madagascar. The Jesus Bikers have a history of presenting motorcycles to popes.

title: Magic of Bumrah: In a world of Messi vs Ronaldo, he is the Ibrahimovic - an outlier
description: Jasprit Bumrah thrives on challenges. He is a non-conformist. He has always chosen the unconventional route. While most athletes are swayed by the Messi-Ronaldo rivalry, his inspiration comes from Zlatan Ibrahimovic, a monster in his own right. During Covid-19, in an Instagram Live with Rohit Sharma, Bumrah had said: "I love Ibra. I can relate to his story that people did not take him seriously and then he became a star. I can relate as I think people took me lightly initially and then I proved them wrong, I am still trying."

Big Boss 19: Neelam Giri opens up about her troubled relationship
description: Kunickaa Sadanand, a contestant on Bigg Boss 19, has revealed details about her personal life, creating a buzz. She shared that she was in a 27-year live-in relationship with a married man who was separated from his wife. Kunickaa ended the relationship after discovering her partner was cheating on her, leading to mixed reactions from fans.

title: ‘Colonial era is over’: Putin tells US it ‘cannot use this tone’ with India, China amid economic pressure

NEET PG 2025: SC dismisses plea to stop counselling, hearing on transparency next week
Delhi rains: Alipur flyover portion caves in
description: New Delhi faced disruptions due to heavy rainfall. A portion of the NH-44 flyover collapsed. Waterlogging and traffic jams were widespread. The Yamuna River exceeded the danger level. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta assessed the situation and assured assistance. The IMD forecasts more rain in the coming days. Interstate cooperation is underway to manage the crisis. Air quality remained satisfactory.

NIRF Rankings List 2025 LIVE: India rankings out; Know top institutions
‘Unacceptable’: Russia responds to potential European military troops deployment in Ukraine
GST revamp: Life & health cover, white goods, most cars to get cheaper
description: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the indirect tax system, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% slab for select goods. Effective September 22nd, these changes aim to reduce tax burdens on common goods, eliminate classification disputes, and boost consumption.

title: 'I fear encounter': On the run, AAP MLA posts video from unknown location
description: Punjab Police are actively searching for AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, who is accused of sexual exploitation and other charges. Pathanmajra released a video denying allegations of attacking police during an attempted arrest in Haryana.

title: 'I was very troubled by her': Man shoots wife dead in busy market in Gorakhpur
description: In Gorakhpur, Vishwakarma Chauhan fatally shot his wife, Mamta, in a public market on Jail Road. The incident occurred after an argument outside a photo studio where Mamta had gone.

title: Minor rape survivor sent back to accused family by CWC, raped again; 10 booked
description: In Panna, Madhya Pradesh, police filed an FIR against ten individuals, including Child Welfare Committee members and officials from the women and child development department, under the POCSO and Juvenile Justice Acts. The action was prompted by the CWC's decision to return a minor rape survivor to the accused's family, leading to further abuse.

title: Trump tariffs on digital taxes? Meta CEO raises concerns; semiconductors at risk
description: Donald Trump has threatened tariffs on nations imposing digital taxes, following concerns raised by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg about European regulatory overreach. Trump, who once called Zuckerberg a 'criminal,' seems to have mended fences, evident from recent White House meetings and Meta's support for Trump's inauguration.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Internal affairs: Why Delhi’s residential roads face a dead end
description: Internal roads in Delhi are in disrepair due to a lack of funds and ineffective schemes. The MCD faces a severe financial crunch, hindering road maintenance despite its responsibility for 12,700km of roads. Residents in areas like Green Park Extension and Laxmi Nagar express frustration over persistent potholes and delayed repairs, with temporary fixes proving inadequate.

title: South Park mocks Trump again; shows Satan pregnant with his child
description: US president Donald Trump faced mockery in the recent South Park episode which aired on Wednesday. The show satirised Trump's relationship with Melania. It also depicted Satan's romantic involvement with Trump. Satan claimed pregnancy and an inability to leave Trump. The episode further included jokes on tariffs and the Labubu craze.
